definitions: covered with a thick coat of soft hair characteristic of animals
having a soft, fluffy texture that resembles animal fur
examples: The furry kitten curled up on the cushion
His furry coat kept him warm in winter
She wore furry slippers around the house
The peach had a slightly furry texture

definitions: extending beyond what exists or has happened; additional or more
at or to a greater distance in space or time
examples: We need further evidence before making a decision
Further discussion will be held next week
The library is further down the street
We can't go any further today

definitions: at or to the greatest distance in space or position
to the greatest degree or extent; most extreme or advanced
examples: The furthest planet from the sun is Neptune
She sat in the furthest corner of the room
This is the furthest we've gotten with negotiations
That's the furthest thing from my mind

definitions: joined or blended together by or as if by melting with intense heat
united or combined into a single entity through integration or merger
examples: The fused glass created a beautiful ornament
The metal parts were fused together permanently
Their fused interests made them perfect partners
The two companies fused into a single corporation

definitions: incapable of producing any useful result; completely ineffective or pointless
examples: His futile attempts to save the business ended in bankruptcy
It was futile to argue with someone so stubborn
The rescue efforts proved futile in the storm
She made a futile gesture of protest

definitions: existing or occurring at a later time; yet to happen or come
of, relating to, or constituting a time that is to come
examples: Future generations will judge our actions today
She's saving money for future expenses
The future development of this area is uncertain
We discussed future plans for the company

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the futurism artistic and social movement
examples: The futurist painters rejected traditional artistic styles
His futurist sculptures emphasized speed and technology
The futurist manifesto influenced many artists
She collected futurist artwork from Italy

definitions: having or involving very modern technology or design that seems to belong to the future
relating to or characteristic of imaginative portrayals of the future
examples: The building's futuristic architecture attracted many visitors
She drove a futuristic electric car
The movie featured futuristic cities and technology
His futuristic vision predicted flying cars

definitions: having a soft, fluffy appearance or texture from fine fibers or hair
not clear, distinct, or precise; blurred or vague in outline
relating to a form of logic allowing for imprecise or partial truths
examples: The fuzzy sweater felt warm and comfortable
The caterpillar had a fuzzy appearance
The old photograph was fuzzy and hard to see
My memories of that day are still fuzzy
Fuzzy logic is used in artificial intelligence systems
The fuzzy set theory handles uncertain data

definitions: talking too much, especially about unimportant things; overly chatty
examples: The gabby neighbor kept her at the door for an hour
He becomes gabby after a few drinks
She's too gabby to keep any secrets
The gabby salesman wouldn't stop talking

definitions: having one or more gables in the architectural structure, especially the roof
examples: The gabled roof gave the house a traditional appearance
They admired the gabled Victorian mansions
The gabled dormer windows added character
A gabled porch welcomed visitors

definitions: mentally confused or senile, especially from old age; not thinking clearly
extremely enthusiastic or infatuated; crazy about something or someone
examples: The elderly man seemed a bit gaga lately
Don't mind her, she's gone completely gaga
She's gaga over her new boyfriend
The fans went gaga when the band appeared

definitions: of or relating to a galaxy, especially the Milky Way galaxy
examples: Scientists study galactic formations through telescopes
The galactic center contains a supermassive black hole
Galactic distances are measured in light years
They discovered new galactic clusters

definitions: brave, spirited, and showing noble qualities, especially in battle or danger
giving special attention and respect to women; chivalrous and attentive
examples: The gallant soldiers defended their position bravely
She made a gallant effort despite the odds
He was gallant enough to offer his seat
The gallant gentleman helped her with her coat

definitions: existing in large quantities or numbers; abundant and plentiful
examples: The festival had food and drinks galore
There were opportunities galore for advancement
The store offered bargains galore during the sale
Problems galore awaited the new manager

definitions: relating to or involving electric currents produced by chemical action
having a sudden, dramatic, and stimulating effect on someone or something
examples: The galvanic cell produced steady electrical current
Galvanic corrosion affected the metal parts
His speech had a galvanic effect on the crowd
The news provided a galvanic shock to markets

definitions: relating to or involved in the activity of betting money on games or events
examples: The gambling industry generates billions in revenue
He had serious gambling debts to pay
Gambling addiction ruined many families
The city's gambling establishments attracted tourists

definitions: eager and willing to do something new, difficult, or dangerous
having an injured or disabled limb, especially used of animals
examples: She was game for any adventure that came along
Are you game to try the spicy challenge?
The horse went game in its left leg
His game ankle slowed him down

definitions: wide open, especially as a gap or hole; opened very wide
examples: A gaping hole appeared in the wall after the explosion
The gaping wound required immediate medical attention
Tourists stood with gaping mouths at the sight
The gaping chasm was too wide to jump

definitions: confused, mixed up, or distorted so as to be misleading or incomprehensible
examples: The garbled message was impossible to understand
She received a garbled version of events
The transmission came through garbled and unclear
His garbled speech suggested he was drunk

definitions: of, relating to, or used in a garden for growing plants
of the common or ordinary type; not special or unusual
examples: She bought garden tools for spring planting
The garden hose needed replacement
It was just a garden variety cold
This is garden variety fraud, nothing sophisticated

definitions: enormous in size, volume, or degree; gigantic and immense
examples: The gargantuan meal could feed ten people
They faced a gargantuan task ahead
The company's gargantuan profits shocked investors
A gargantuan creature emerged from the depths

definitions: obtrusively bright and showy in a way that is tasteless or vulgar
examples: The garish neon lights hurt her eyes
He wore a garish Hawaiian shirt to the meeting
The room's garish decorations clashed horribly
Her garish makeup was inappropriate for work

definitions: existing as or having the characteristics of gas; not solid or liquid
examples: Water becomes gaseous when it evaporates into steam
The gaseous emissions from the factory were monitored
Gaseous planets like Jupiter have no solid surface
The gaseous mixture filled the chamber

definitions: of, relating to, or near the stomach in the digestive system
examples: She suffered from severe gastric problems
The doctor prescribed gastric medication
Gastric juices help digest food
He underwent gastric bypass surgery

definitions: relating to or affecting the stomach and intestines in the digestive system
examples: The patient experienced gastrointestinal distress after eating
Gastrointestinal disorders require specialized treatment
The medication may cause gastrointestinal side effects
She consulted a gastrointestinal specialist

definitions: relating to the art and science of good eating and fine cuisine
examples: The city offered many gastronomic delights
Their gastronomic adventure included five restaurants
She wrote gastronomic reviews for magazines
The gastronomic festival attracted food lovers

definitions: brought together or assembled from various places or sources
drawn together in small folds or pleats, especially in fabric
examples: The gathered crowd waited for the announcement
All gathered information pointed to fraud
The gathered skirt flattered her figure
She wore a dress with gathered sleeves

definitions: lacking social grace, sensitivity, or acuteness; awkward and tactless
examples: His gauche behavior embarrassed everyone at dinner
It was gauche to mention money so directly
Her gauche attempts at humor fell flat
The gauche teenager didn't know proper etiquette

definitions: extravagantly bright or showy in a way that is tasteless or vulgar
examples: The gaudy jewelry looked cheap and flashy
He decorated his room with gaudy posters
She wore a gaudy dress to the formal event
The gaudy casino lights flashed constantly

definitions: lean and haggard, especially from hunger, age, or illness
grim or desolate in appearance; barren and forbidding
examples: His gaunt face showed the effects of illness
The gaunt prisoner had barely eaten for weeks
The gaunt landscape stretched for miles
Gaunt trees stood against the winter sky

definitions: sexually or romantically attracted to people of one's own sex
lighthearted and carefree; showing or characterized by cheerfulness
examples: The gay couple celebrated their anniversary
She came out as gay to her parents
The room was decorated in gay colors
They spent a gay evening dancing

definitions: designed, organized, or adjusted to be suitable for a particular purpose or situation
examples: The program is geared toward young professionals
This car is geared for high performance
The curriculum was geared to practical skills
Their strategy is geared for long-term growth

definitions: having a jelly-like consistency; viscous and semi-transparent like gelatin
examples: The gelatinous substance oozed from the wound
Jellyfish have gelatinous bodies
The soup had a gelatinous texture when cold
A gelatinous mass floated in the jar

definitions: relating to the study or tracing of lines of family descent and history
examples: She conducted genealogical research on her ancestors
The genealogical records dated back centuries
They discovered genealogical connections to royalty
The genealogical chart showed five generations

definitions: made general or broad in application rather than specific or limited
not detailed or specific; involving only main features
examples: The generalised findings apply to many situations
She experienced generalised anxiety about everything
He made generalised statements without evidence
The doctor noted generalised inflammation

definitions: made general or broad in application rather than specific or limited
not detailed or specific; involving only main features
examples: The generalized theory applies to all cases
Generalized pain affected her whole body
His generalized comments lacked specific details
The study produced generalized conclusions

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a particular generation or successive generations
examples: Generational differences caused workplace conflicts
The family business faced generational change
They studied generational patterns in voting
Generational wealth passed to the children

definitions: having the ability to produce, create, or generate something new
examples: Generative AI can create original content
The generative process produced innovative solutions
Her generative imagination created wonderful stories
They studied generative grammar in linguistics

definitions: characteristic of or relating to a whole class or group; general
not protected by trademark; not brand-name
examples: This is a generic problem affecting all models
She gave a generic response to the question
Generic drugs cost less than brand names
The store sells generic products

definitions: showing readiness to give more than is necessary or expected
larger or more plentiful than is usual or necessary
examples: She was generous with her time and money
The generous donor gave millions to charity
They served generous portions at the restaurant
He received a generous salary increase

definitions: relating to genes or heredity; determined by genetic factors
relating to the origin or development of something
examples: Genetic testing revealed a hereditary condition
She studied genetic mutations in fruit flies
The genetic relationship between languages fascinated him
They traced the genetic development of the idea

definitions: friendly, cheerful, and pleasant in manner; showing kindness and warmth
examples: The genial host made everyone feel welcome
Her genial personality attracted many friends
He gave a genial smile to the newcomers
The genial atmosphere put guests at ease

definitions: of or relating to the external reproductive organs
examples: The doctor examined the genital area for abnormalities
Genital infections require immediate treatment
They discussed genital health in the class
The genital examination was part of the checkup

definitions: relating to the grammatical case that shows possession or association
examples: The genitive case in Latin shows ownership
English uses apostrophes for genitive forms
Students struggled with genitive constructions
The genitive ending varies by language

definitions: refined in manner; well-bred and polite in a formal way
affectedly refined or trying to appear of higher social class
examples: She maintained a genteel manner despite poverty
The genteel neighborhood had elegant homes
His genteel pretensions fooled nobody
They put on genteel airs at the party

definitions: not Jewish; of or relating to non-Jewish people
examples: The gentile population lived alongside Jewish families
They welcomed both Jewish and gentile members
Gentile customs differed from Jewish traditions
The gentile nations were mentioned in scripture

definitions: having or showing a mild, kind, or tender temperament or character
not harsh or severe; soft in action or effect
gradual and moderate rather than sudden or extreme
examples: She had a gentle way with frightened animals
The gentle teacher never raised her voice
Use a gentle soap for sensitive skin
A gentle breeze stirred the leaves
The path made a gentle climb up the hill
Apply gentle pressure to stop bleeding

definitions: behaving in the polite, honorable way expected of a gentleman; courteous and considerate
examples: His gentlemanly behavior impressed her parents
He maintained a gentlemanly composure despite provocation
The gentlemanly gesture of holding doors was appreciated
They settled disputes in a gentlemanly fashion

definitions: truly what something is said to be; authentic and not counterfeit
sincere and honest; free from pretense or deceit
examples: The painting was certified as genuine
This is genuine leather, not synthetic
Her genuine concern touched everyone deeply
He showed genuine interest in the project
